element.name: Name
element.desc: The name of the driver. Condition is that at least one of this and BusDriver/EmpLink must be included.

element.name: EmployeePersonalRefId
element.desc: The GUID of the driver's EmployeePersonal object. Condition is that at least one of this and BusDriver/Name must be included.

element.name: Status
element.desc: Boarding status of the driver.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: GUID that identifies this type of equipment.

element.name: Description
element.desc: Explanation about the type of equipment.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: GUID that identifies this bus.

element.name: VehicleNumber
element.desc: Vehicle number of the bus.

element.name: SeatingCapacity
element.desc: The number of people who can ride on the bus at the same time.

element.name: Contractor
element.desc: The name of the contractor for this bus.

element.name: ManufactureYear
element.desc: The manufacture year of the bus (CCYY).

element.name: VehicleIdentificationNumber
element.desc: The Vehicle Identification Number (VIN) of the bus.

element.name: LicensePlateNumber
element.desc: The vehicle's license plate number.

attribute.name: BusInfoRefId
attribute.desc: The GUID that identifies the bus. This object only has meaning as current data for this particular bus.

element.name: Date
element.desc: The date of the report from the bus.

element.name: Time
element.desc: The time of the report from the bus.

element.name: GridLocation
element.desc: The location of the bus.

element.name: TelematicsId
element.desc: ID of the hardware unit on the bus that tracks & reports location and status. The interpretation of the content is deployment specific, but the format must be compact.

element.name: TelemetryList
element.desc: Indicators and values provided by the hardware along with this position snapshot. For events, it is safe to assume that one of these items triggered the hardware to issue an update.

element.name: OtherStatus
element.desc: If the bus is not running a regularly scheduled route but is transporting (or positioning to transport) passengers as approved and directed by the school district, this element describes the activity. It's also used for maintenance, repair, and other authorized movements. This element is mutually exclusive with RouteStatus. Absence of both RouteStatus and OtherStatus is acceptable, but may indicate unauthorized operation.

element.name: Odometer
element.desc: Current odometer reading.

element.name: Speedometer
element.desc: Current speedometer reading.

element.name: Students
element.desc: List of students and their status. The complete list may be sent with some events (e.g. change in RouteStatus) per district policy, but it is more typical of responses.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: GUID that identifies this object.

attribute.name: BusRouteInfoRefId
attribute.desc: GUID that identifies the bus route. See the BusRoute specification for more details.

element.name: BusStopInfoRefId
element.desc: Describes a bus stop

element.name: ArrivalTime
element.desc: The time that the bus associated with this route will stop at this bus stop.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: GUID that identifies this bus route.

element.name: RouteNumber
element.desc: A unique identifier for the route. It may contain any printable ASCII character. For instance, you may have route 16AM in the morning and a 16PM in the afternoon.

element.name: RouteType
element.desc: The type of route.

element.name: MaximumLoad
element.desc: The maximum number of students who are on the bus at any point along this route.

element.name: Description
element.desc: Short explanation of the route. It may be used to designate an area, or used to color-code bus routes (the "orange" route).

element.name: Name
element.desc: Name of the driver who drives this route.

element.name: RouteDistanceLoaded
element.desc: Refers to the distance the bus drives when at least one student is riding the bus.

element.name: RouteDistanceTotal
element.desc: Includes the total distance driven for this route including to and from garage.

object.name: BusStaff
object.desc: List identifying other staff. This may include aides, nurses, proctors, etc.

element.name: Name
element.desc: The name of this staff member. Condition is that at least one of this and BusStaff/EmpLink must be included.

element.name: Status
element.desc: Boarding status of this staff member.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: GUID that identifies this location.

element.name: Description
element.desc: An explanation of this location.

element.name: GridLocation
element.desc: The location of the bus stop.

attribute.name: BusRouteDetailRefId
attribute.desc: GUID that identifies the bus stop/route where the student gets off the bus.

element.name: ArrivalTime
element.desc: The time that the bus associated with this route will stop at this bus stop.

element.name: RouteNumber
element.desc: A unique identifier for the route. F or instance, you may have route 16AM in the morning and a 16PM in the afternoon.

element.name: RouteDescription
element.desc: Short explanation of the route. It may be used to designate an area, or used to color-code bus routes (the "orange" route).

element.name: BusStopDescription
element.desc: An explanation of this location.

attribute.name: Unit
attribute.desc: Units used in the odometer reading.

object.name: EmpLink
object.desc: Attribute carries the GUID of the driver’s EmployeePersonal object. Condition is that at least one of this and BusDriver/Name must be included.

attribute.name: EmployeePersonalRefId
attribute.desc: GUID

element.name: BusEquipmentRefId
element.desc: GUID that identifies the type of equipment

element.name: Count
element.desc: The number of pieces of this type of equipment

object.name: HomeBusRouteDetail
object.desc: GUID referring to a BusRouteDetail object that identifies the origin bus stop for an inbound route or the destination bus stop for an outbound route. If the HomeBusRouteDetail element does not exist, then the student does not ride a bus to/from school.

attribute.name: SIF_RefObject
attribute.desc: Must be set to BusRouteDetail

attribute.name: Unit
attribute.desc: Units used in the odometer reading.

attribute.name: BusRouteDetailRefId
attribute.desc: GUID that identifies the bus stop/route where the student gets on the bus.

element.name: ArrivalTime
element.desc: The time that the bus associated with this route will stop at this bus stop.

element.name: RouteNumber
element.desc: A unique identifier for the route. For instance, you may have route 16AM in the morning and a 16PM in the afternoon.

element.name: RouteDescription
element.desc: Short explanation of the route.

element.name: VehicleNumber
element.desc: Vehicle number of the bus.

element.name: BusStopDescription
element.desc: An explanation of this location.

element.name: BusRouteInfoRefId
element.desc: GUID

element.name: Status
element.desc: Status of the route.

object.name: SchoolBusRouteDetail
object.desc: GUID referring to a BusRouteDetail object that identifies the origin bus stop for an outbound route or the destination bus stop for an inbound route. If the SchoolBusRouteDetail does not exist, then the student does not ride a bus to/from school.

attribute.name: SIF_RefObject
attribute.desc: GUID referring to a BusRouteDetail object that identifies the origin bus stop for an inbound route or the destination bus stop for an outbound route.

attribute.name: Unit
attribute.desc: Units used in the speedometer reading.

value.name: ON
value.desc: boarded the bus and no exit detected

value.name: SCHED
value.desc: scheduled for this run, but either hasn't boarded or the telematics hardware can't confirm their identity

value.name: ON
value.desc: boarded the bus and no exit detected

value.name: ENTERED
value.desc: boarded the bus since previous event

value.name: EXITED
value.desc: left the bus since previous event

value.name: SCHED
value.desc: scheduled for this run, but either hasn't boarded or the telematics hardware can't confirm their identity

object.name: StudentTransportInfo
object.desc: This object contains transportation information about a student. Students should have at least two StudentTransportInfo objects associated with them: one for inbound information (getting to school) and one for outbound information (leaving school). If their transportation changes based on the day of the week, then a student will have more than two StudentTransportInfo objects.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: GUID that identifies this object.

attribute.name: StudentPersonalRefId
attribute.desc: GUID that identifies the student that this object refers to.

attribute.name: Type
attribute.desc: The direction of transportation that this object refers to.

attribute.name: DayOfWeek
attribute.desc: This attribute indicates the day(s) of the week to which this object refers.

attribute.name: SchoolInfoRefId
attribute.desc: GUID referring to the school that the student attends on these day(s) of the week.

element.name: Eligibility
element.desc: Eligibility status of student for district transportation for this trip.

element.name: HomeToSchoolDistance
element.desc: Distance between the student's home address and the school.

element.name: WalkToStopDistance
element.desc: Distance between the student's address and the bus stop where they are picked up or dropped off.

element.name: StopToSchoolDistance
element.desc: Distance between the bus stop where a student is picked up or dropped off and the school.

element.name: HomeBusRouteDetail
element.desc: If the HomeBusRouteDetail element does not exist then the student does not ride a bus to/from school.

element.name: TransferPoints
element.desc: There should be one TransferPoint for each intermediate point on a trip. The "embark" and "disembark" bus stops for a single transfer point must be at the same location. To order multiple TransferPoint elements, use the Time element of the BusStopInfo objects referenced by the attributes.

element.name: SchoolBusRouteDetail
element.desc: If the SchoolBusRouteDetail element does not exist then the student does not ride a bus to/from school.

element.name: StateAidQualification
element.desc: The qualification status of a student entitling local education agency to receive state transportation aid.

element.name: TransportationStatus
element.desc: Information about whether or not a student is transported to and/or from school or receives services, aid, or payment in lieu of transportation.

element.name: PublicExpense
element.desc: The eligibility of a student for transportation between home and school at local public expense because of distance, disability, or other reasons.

element.name: Telemetry
element.desc: Indicators and values provided by the hardware along with this position snapshot. For events, it is safe to assume that one of these items triggered the hardware to issue an update.

object.name: TransferPoint
object.desc: Describes a transfer point for each intermediate point on a trip

element.name: EmbarkBusRouteDetail
element.desc: The GUID that identifies the bus stop/route when the student gets on the bus.

element.name: DisembarkBusRouteDetail
element.desc: The GUID that identifies the bus stop/route when the student gets off the bus.

object.name: TransStudent
object.desc: List of students and their status. The complete list may be sent with some events (e.g. change in RouteStatus) per district policy, but it is more typical of responses.

element.name: StudentPersonalRefId
element.desc: GUID that identifies the student that this element refers to.

element.name: Status
element.desc: Boarding status of this student
